Package noppes.npcs.api.entity

Interface ICustomNpc<T extends Mob>

All Superinterfaces:
IEntity<T>, IEntityLiving<T>, IMob<T>
public interface ICustomNpc<T extends Mob> extends IMob<T>

Represents a custom NPC.

The following entity types in CNPC are represented by this interface:

  • customnpcs:customnpc
  • customnpcs:customnpc64x32
  • customnpcs:customnpcalex
  • customnpcs:customnpcclassic
  • customnpcs:npccrystal
  • customnpcs:npcdragon
  • customnpcs:npcgolem
  • customnpcs:npcpony
  • customnpcs:npcslime

    • getRole

      INPCRole getRole()

      Gets the role settings of the custom NPC.

      Returns:
      The role settings of the custom NPC.

      If the custom NPC does not have a role, this method returns an instance of the INPCRole interface whose INPCRole.getType() method returns RoleType.NONE.

      Since:
      1.8.9(29oct16)

    • getJob

      INPCJob getJob()

      Gets the job settings of the custom NPC.

      Returns:
      The job settings of the custom NPC.

      If the custom NPC does not have a job, this method returns an instance of the INPCJob interface whose INPCJob.getType() method returns JobType.NONE.

      Since:
      1.8.9(29oct16)

    • getOwner

      IEntityLiving getOwner()

      Gets the owner entity of the custom NPC.

      Returns:
      The owner entity of the custom NPC, or null.

      This method uses the following logic:

      1. If the custom NPC is instructed by a scene command to follow an entity, the followed entity is returned.
      2. Otherwise, if the role of the custom NPC is Follower, the owner entity (or null if the custom NPC is not hired) is returned.
      3. Otherwise, if the role of the custom NPC is Companion, the owner entity (or null) is returned.
      4. Otherwise, if the job of the custom NPC is Follower, the followed entity (or null if the custom NPC is not following an entity) is returned.
      5. Otherwise, null is returned.

      If the custom NPC has a Follower or Companion role and a Follower job at the same time, the followed entity specified in the Follower job settings is never returned.

      Since:
      1.12.2-05Jan19snapshot

    • setHome

      void setHome(int x, int y, int z)

      Sets the home position of the custom NPC.

      Parameters:
      x - The X coordinate of the home position of the custom NPC.
      y - The Y coordinate of the home position of the custom NPC.
      z - The Z coordinate of the home position of the custom NPC.

    • reset

      void reset()

      Resets the custom NPC.

    • say

      void say(String message)

      Says a message to the players that can be seen by the custom NPC and whose hitboxes have intersection with the hitbox of the custom NPC extended by 40 blocks in width and height.

      If NpcSpeachTriggersChatEvent is set to true in CustomNpcs.cfg, a ServerChatEvent will be fired before the message is sent, and canceling that event prevents the message from being sent.

      Parameters:
      message - A non-null message to be said.

      If message is an empty string, no message will be sent.

    • sayTo

      void sayTo(IPlayer player, String message)

      Says a message to a player.

      Parameters:
      player - A player to say the message to.

      If the custom NPC cannot see the player, no message will be sent.

      message - A non-null message to be said.

      If message is an empty string, no message will be sent.

      Since:
      1.8.9(29oct16)

    • shootItem

      IProjectile shootItem(IEntityLiving target, IItemStack item, int accuracy)

      Shoots an item stack as a projectile towards a target.

      Parameters:
      target - The target entity.
      item - The item stack to be shot.
      accuracy - The accuracy of the shot.

      accuracy is clamped between 1 (inclusive) and 100 (inclusive.)

      Returns:
      The shot projectile entity.

      Prior to 1.12.2-07jul18snapshot, this method returns void.

      Throws:
      CustomNPCsException - target or item is null.
      Since:
      1.8.9(29oct16)

    • shootItem

      IProjectile shootItem(double x, double y, double z, IItemStack item, int accuracy)

      Shoots an item stack as a projectile towards a position.

      Parameters:
      x - The X coordinate of the target position.
      y - The Y coordinate of the target position.
      z - The Z coordinate of the target position.
      item - The item stack to be shot.
      accuracy - The accuracy of the shot.

      accuracy is clamped between 1 (inclusive) and 100 (inclusive.)

      Returns:
      The shot projectile entity.

      Prior to 1.12.2-07jul18snapshot, this method returns void.

      Throws:
      CustomNPCsException - item is null.
      Since:
      1.11.2(29oct17), 1.10.2(21jul17)

    • giveItem

      void giveItem(IPlayer player, IItemStack item)

      Spawns an item entity near a player.

      Parameters:
      player - A non-null player entity where the item entity is to be spawned.
      item - A non-null item stack that the item entity carries.
      Since:
      1.8.9(29oct16)

    • setDialog

      void setDialog(int slot, IDialog dialog)

      Assigns a dialog to a dialog slot of the custom NPC.

      Parameters:
      slot - The index of the dialog slot.
      dialog - The dialog to be assigned.

      If dialog is null, the dialog slot will be cleared.

      Throws:
      CustomNPCsException - slot is less than 0 or greater than 11.
      Since:
      1.11.2(29oct17), 1.10.2(21jul17)

    • getDialog

      IDialog getDialog(int slot)

      Gets the dialog in a dialog slot of the custom NPC.

      Parameters:
      slot - The index of the dialog slot.
      Returns:
      The dialog in the specified dialog slot, or null if the dialog slot is not assigned.
      Throws:
      CustomNPCsException - slot is less than 0 or greater than 11.
      Since:
      1.11.2(29oct17), 1.10.2(21jul17)

    • updateClient

      void updateClient()

      Sends the spawn data of the custom NPC to the client.

      Since:
      1.12.2-07jul18snapshot

    • executeCommand

      String executeCommand(String command)

      Executes a command as the custom NPC.

      On a server, the enable-command-block option in the server.properties must be set to true.

      This method cannot execute the commands that require permission level greater than 2 if NpcUseOpCommands is set to false in CustomNpcs.cfg. See the Minecraft Wiki for the permission level for each command.

      The commands are run under the UUID c9c843f8-4cb1-4c82-aa61-e264291b7bd6 and the name [customnpcs].

      Parameters:
      command - The command to be executed.
      Returns:
      The command output.

      Prior to 1.11.2(29oct17) or 1.10.2(21jul17), this method returns void.

      Since:
      1.8.9(29oct16)

    • trigger

      void trigger(int id, Object... arguments)

      Fires a WorldEvent.ScriptTriggerEvent event.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the event.
      arguments - The arguments of the event.
      Since:
      1.16.5.20220607snapshot
